intro: Hieracium medinense, commonly known as the Medinense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds through wind dispersal.
